detailed_goals: Familiarize with historical seasonal influenza data available in the EHR system and current quality issues as highlighted by the Medical Records Specialists' feedback.
Develop initial metrics to analyze influenza trends ensuring alignment with clinical practices emphasized by Registered Nurses.
Prepare a draft methodology considering feedback for further discussions in team meetings.
Lead the project, ensuring alignment with clinical standards and guiding the overall strategy for data collection and analysis.
Develop and oversee the implementation of clinical protocols for EHR data collection specific to seasonal influenza cases.
Establish feedback mechanisms to assess the effectiveness of EHR data features.
Review current QA protocols and identify gaps within the existing testing methods focused on EHR data related to seasonal influenza.
Collaborate with Data Analysts to understand the types of influenza-related data being collected and improve verification methods.
Develop a checklist for testing data quality and accuracy in conjunction with the insights from Registered Nurses.
Conduct a meeting with team members to outline project goals and methodology.
Review weekly goals and contributions for alignment among team roles.
Develop a consolidated training plan for healthcare staff on how to effectively utilize the EHR for influenza data entry.
Update support materials available to ensure all training modules address common issues.
Prepare an FAQ list aimed at addressing concerns raised by all employee feedback.
Develop a training plan for healthcare staff on how to use the EHR for influenza data entry.
Review support materials available for the EHR system related to influenza cases and suggest any needed updates.
Prepare a list of frequently asked questions (FAQs) that address common issues reported by staff.
